channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dropped Ironwork & Holes, 5th January
item.description:
There’s a pothole and dropped drain lid on the giveaway lines for the mini round about. It’s located on Hatherley Lane coming from Asda, past the C3 church on your left. ///track.stars.hill

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Patchwork Repairs have Failed - Again!, 5th January
item.description:
A couple of years ago this was just a standard sized pot hole. Now because of all the poorly completed patchwork temporary repair jobs this has created many potholes and the area to sink inwards! ///grand.lakes.kite Opposite Wade Court junction but on the side nearest the model railway area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water pools at pedestrian crossing because drain is not at low ground, 5th January
item.description:
New pedestrian crossing floods due to there not being a drain at low ground. The issue is that the drains are on high ground and therefore jetting them cannot (and has not) rectified this problem. The deep and wide pooling is present after any substantial rainfall, which has been quite frequent. Whether as a result of a design problem or a construction problem, it is completely obvious that the issue is the failure to have a drain at low ground where the water pools. The effect of this mistake is water pools where pedestrians are meant to stand and then cross. The result is that pedestrians stand at the cycle crossing. Hundreds of small children cross here every school day. There will be an accident if this is not fixed. This a real risk. I have reported this exact issue repeatedly. It needs to be fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is an ongoing issue and I was informed that it was resolved back in November, it is impossible for small children to walk through as it is too deep and as you can see the verges are now covered with the water and very slippery. Elderly people are unable to walk through as the potholes under the water are now very dangerous as you cannot see them. Some vehicles cannot drive through for the same reason., 5th January
item.description:
The issue is in the same location as the numerous reports that have been sent in, outside the barn past the Church as indicated on the map.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brock Farm Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entrance to the car park is dangerous - if private land, should the licence to operate be revoked?, 4th January

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, North Place, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain needs unblocking, 4th January
item.description:
At the end of leadon close, at the cauldisac, where the is the parking area. At the end by the bungalows, the drain next to the bromford housing containers, at the corner are blocked. The drain doesn't drain at all when there is alot of rain. If someone could sort this, that would be great. Thankyou :)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Non permit parking, 4th January
item.description:
This person (number 24) has Parked infront of neighbours drive (23) on a permit only street with no permit, she has repeatedly asked him not to obstruct her drive but keeps doing so. Brighton road, Cheltenham.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Brighton Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface in the dip is breaking down again, 4th January
item.description:
This dip is a constant problem and needs more than patching. This stretch needed repair several times last year and just keeps breaking down. Water collects so you can't see the puddles, as well as doing more damage. Please can this be reviewed for resurfacing and not just patching

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A hole has appeared in the footpath it could be linked to the verge sinking., 4th January
item.description:
The small tree outside No. 3 is dead and verge is sinking. Also there are 2 holes in the verge where there was rat activity. I have dealt with the rats as I am qualified pest controller. The footpath is beginning to collapse there is a hole of 18''x 5'' x 6''. There is also an issue by the drain warring surface has gone and it gets covered in weeds.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Witley Lodge Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
